abstract: Several members of jury that failed to reach decision in murder trial of Pedro Hernandez in Etan Patz case make rare public appearance outside courthouse, giving conflicting accounts to news media of bitter divisions that led to hung jury; passionate stance reflects difficulty of case and challenge court will face as it seeks impartial panel for retrial.
lead_paragraph: Several jurors who failed to reach a decision in the trial of a man accused of killing Etan in 1979 showed up at the defendant’s court appearance, airing the bitter divisions that led to a hung jury.

headline.main: Jurors’ Rancorous Split Over Etan Patz Mistrial Remains on Display Outside Hearing
headline.print_headline: Jurors’ Rancorous Split Over Patz Mistrial Remains on Display Outside Hearing

snippet: Several jurors who failed to reach a decision in the trial of a man accused of killing Etan in 1979 showed up at the defendant’s court appearance, airing the bitter divisions that led to a hung jury.
